channel.title: Hard drive epic fail
channel.description:
Ya...so I unplugged my usb hd too early and now its a little mad at me...
Windows takes forever to read it and then says its not formatted Yet I run my partitioning programs and TestDisk and it found all the files and knows its FAT32
So obviously its probably not the partition itself.
Ideas?
Note: ScanDisk crashes when I run it on the drive (it found it to be FAT32 too but then it crashes) Note: This drive doesn't work in other computers either so don't suggest that.

item.title: Hard drive epic fail
item.dc:creator: @nicatron nicatron
item.description:
@nicatron wrote:

try a live linux distro with NTFS3G, if it’s a windows problem, this will help.

Read full topic

item.title: Hard drive epic fail
item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

Not off hand, try googling it. I would help more but I am just about to walk out the door.

Read full topic

item.title: Hard drive epic fail
item.dc:creator: @Bang_Train Bang Train
item.description:
@Bang_Train wrote:

therealjdb:

I believe certain partitioning software have recovery capabilities, so I would suggest trying one of those to recover important data then reformat.

know any that can retrieve only certain files?

cuz i cant backup entire partition not enough room…

Read full topic

item.title: Hard drive epic fail
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

just yesterday i broke my 500gb external… fell off the top of my pc tower and was still working fine untill i turned it off, and then back on again.

Only had about 30gb of data on it… lucky i kept my coursework safe on my laptop. (Although now i’ve lost all my runescape account records and other crap).

^^ My post is pretty pointless just thought I’d post about a similar thing.

Read full topic

item.title: Hard drive epic fail
item.dc:creator: @sidishere sidishere
item.description:
@sidishere wrote:

it happened to me before and i had to chuck the hard disk out, all my data was lost.

Read full topic

item.description:
@ninja_nub wrote:

Well, if your good at welding, erm it’s self-explanitory from there. If you aren’t, take it to a computer repair shop to see what they can do.

item.title: Hard drive epic fail
item.dc:creator: @Bang_Train Bang Train
item.description:
@Bang_Train wrote:

i dont want to…i got data on it i need… Ill proboly get a new external for X-Mas and transfer the partition over

Read full topic

item.title: Hard drive epic fail
item.dc:creator: @ninja_nub ninja nub
item.description:
@ninja_nub wrote:

Well, I had a similar problem (2nd time) and pins were working. What I did was reformat it (if you can) then try reinstalling the driver.

Read full topic

item.title: Hard drive epic fail
item.dc:creator: @Bang_Train Bang Train
item.description:
@Bang_Train wrote:

ninja nub:

Check to see if the pins are aligned because say if a pin is bent then it’ll have trouble reading it and will come up as a wrong format.

its in an external case (so pins never move)

Read full topic

item.title: Hard drive epic fail

item.description:

[quote=“FastBawlz, post:2, topic:160936”]I unplugged one of my externals and then it broke…

Maybe thats what happened?[/quote]

that is what happened…but there data is there…thats the issue windows thinks its not formatted…but it is
